snippet: Despite traps trampled by cattle and engine troubles, scientists studying quail hybridization in Mexico capture their first elegant quail.
abstract: Despite traps trampled by cattle and engine troubles, scientists studying quail hybridization in Mexico capture their first elegant quail.
lead_paragraph: Jennifer Gee, a biologist at the Claremont University Consortium and the University of California, Riverside, writes from the tropical dry forest near Álamos, Mexico, where she and Jennifer Calkins are studying Callipepla quail.
